content: My review does not reflect performance. It runs very well on the shield tablet and I cannot complain about any of the technical aspects. My score is purely driven by the fact that this game is just bad. It was created at a time when, because of brilliant games like Half Life which had a compelling way of integrating story into the game play, developers thought that all games had to mimic that style. Doom really doesn't benefit from that kind of design, it just gets bogged down. Aside from the overly used mechanic of things suddenly jumping out at you the game is tediously slow moving. Doom was always about running and gunning. Lots of monsters, lots of guns, and lots of ammo. This game is about dimly lit, claustrophobic passage after passage with no clear way forward. The game would have been helped out immensely by a way point system. As it is the game is just frustrating. I cannot recommend this title. I've gotten about a third of the way through it and have no desire to go the rest of the way.
